page.title: 19CHURCHES_COSHESTON/PEMBROKE
page.content: Cosheston is one of the oldest parishes recorded. There are remains of an old monk's cell nearby and there is the socket from and old celtic preaching cross in the churchyard. St Michael's Church was rebuilt in 1881. There was a spire on the tower, but in 1980 it was pulled down because it was unsafe. Also in Cosheston is a Evangelical Mission Hall. At Lower Nash there is another Church in Wales building, dedicated to the Virgin Mary. Churchgoers in North Pembroke attend the chapels and churches in Pembroke & Pembroke Dock. Not as many people go to church now as in the past but there are still many chapels and churches in the town. Especially popular are the Non_ conformist chapels, the Catholic churches & the Church in Wales churches.
